ETYMOLOGY: From Late Middle English, from medieval Latin 'perspectiva (ars)' (optic art), feminine of 'perspectivus' (of sight), from 'perspectus', past participle of 'perspicere' (look through), from 'per-' (through) + 'specere' (to look).

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A particular attitude toward or way of regarding something; a point of view.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 看待事物的方式；观点；看法；角度
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Her unique perspective on the issue helped us find a new solution.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她对这个问题的独特看法帮助我们找到了新的解决方案。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The art of drawing solid objects on a two-dimensional surface so as to give the right impression of their height, width, depth, and position in relation to each other when viewed from a particular point.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The artist used linear perspective to create the illusion of depth in the painting.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这位艺术家运用线性透视法在画作中营造了深度错觉。

MEANINGS.PATTERN:
keep [sth] in perspective
put [sth] into perspective | lose perspective
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A true understanding of the relative importance of something; a sense of proportion.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 对事物的正确判断；看清重要性；保持客观的判断
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: It's important to keep your problems in perspective and not let them overwhelm you.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 重要的是要正确看待你的问题，不要让它们压垮你。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: From the mountaintop, we enjoyed a breathtaking perspective of the valley below.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 从山顶上，我们欣赏到了山谷下方令人惊叹的远景。
